post.description: This API allows you to create creatives of various types by providing the creative metadata and creative files using multipart/form-data. The metadata is sent as a JSON string in the 'creativeRequest' form field, and files (when creativeSourceType is 'FILE') are uploaded in the 'creativeFiles' form field. The API supports batch creation of multiple creatives in a single request, with partial success/failure handling.

requestBody.description: Multipart form data containing creative metadata as JSON string and optional file uploads

parameters.description: creativeId of the creative (primary key) to retrieve details

patch.description:
This API endpoint allows authorized users to update the details of an existing creative. 
 The creative's attributes can be modified by advertisers, workspaces, or super users. 
 The creative can be updated with a name, external creative ID, rejection reason, and remarks.  
 Additionally, ownership and edit permissions are validated to ensure the request is authorized.

---

#### Request Body Detail

| **Field** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| creativeName | String | Represents name of the creative |
| externalCreativeId | String | Represents 3rd party id |
| creativeRejectionReason | String | Represents reason for rejecting the creative if applicable |
| creativeRemarks | String | Represents remarks to be added for this creative |

parameters.name: creativeId
parameters.description: id of the creative (primary key) to update details

Edit existing creative by workspace/supe.description: Edit existing creative by workspace/super user

Invalid creative id passed for update.description: Invalid creative id passed for update

get.description: Retrieve details of a specific creative along with its associated campaigns. Includes an option to fetch modeling details if requested.

parameters.name: creativeId
parameters.description: Unique ID of the creative whose associated campaigns are to be retrieved

parameters.name: includeModelingInfo
parameters.description: Flag indicating whether modeling details should be included (default: false)

200.description: Creative and associated campaigns retrieved successfully

patch.description:
This API assigns/un-assigns creatives from campaigns.


---

#### Request Body Detail

| **Field** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| assignedCampaignIds `[optional]` | Array of Integer | List of campaign IDs for assigning creative targeting. |
| removedCampaignIds `[optional]` | Array of Integer | List of campaign IDs for un-assigning/removing creative targeting. |
| creativeIds | Array of Integer | List of creatives for assign/un-assign. |

errorObjects.error: Please provide valid Campaign IDs for assign/un-assign action

patch.description:
This API endpoint allows authorized users to update the status of an existing creative. 
 Updating a Creative's status to "deleted" is how to remove a Creative from the system. 
 The creative's attributes can be modified by advertisers, workspaces, or super users. 
 Additionally, ownership and edit permissions are validated to ensure the request is authorized.

---

#### Request Body Detail

| **Field** | **Type** | **Description** |
| --- | --- | --- |
| creativeIds | List<Integer> | Represents list of creative ids |
| creativeStatusId | Integer | Creative status ID: 1=pending, 2=running, 3=paused, 4=deleted, 5=rejected|
| creativeRejectionReason | String | Represents the reason for rejecting a creative |

requestBody.description: Request to update the status of creatives

Delete creative.summary: Set creativeStatusId to 4 to mark as deleted

Reject creative.summary: Set creativeStatusId to 5 and provide rejection reason

CreativeListRequest.description: Request for filtering and listing creatives with optional metadata and ownership filters.

creativeRequest.description: JSON string containing a map of unique identifiers to creative metadata. Each key is a temporary reference ID used to track the creative through the creation process and correlate it with uploaded files. Common key patterns include: H001-H999 (HTML creatives), I001-I999 (Image creatives), V001-V999 (Video creatives), A001-A999 (Audio creatives), NI001-NI999 (Native Image creatives), NV001-NV999 (Native Video creatives). The key can be any unique string identifier. The value is a CreateCreativeRequest object containing all creative metadata including creativeName, platformCreativeTypeId, creativeSourceType, clickUrl, and type-specific details. When creativeSourceType is 'FILE', the creativeSource field should contain the filename that matches one of the files in the creativeFiles array.

creativeFiles.description: Array of creative files to upload. This field is required when any creative in the creativeRequest has creativeSourceType set to 'FILE'. The filename of each uploaded file must match the creativeSource value specified in the corresponding creative metadata. Supported file types include images (JPEG, PNG, GIF), videos (MP4, WebM), and audio (MP3, WAV). Multiple files can be uploaded in a single request to support batch creative creation.

CreateCreativeMultipartRequest.description: Multipart form data for creating creatives with optional file uploads

additionalProperties.description: A map containing key-value pairs for the successful Creative operations. Each entry represents a successful Creative addition from request as a key and creativeId as value.

successData.description: A map containing key-value pairs for the successful Creative operations. Each entry represents a successful Creative addition from request as a key and creativeId as value.

additionalProperties.description: A map containing key-value pairs for the failed Creative operations. Each entry represents a failed attempt to add a Creative with unique identifier from request as a key and exception/error message as value.

failedData.description: A map containing key-value pairs for the failed Creative operations. Each entry represents a failed attempt to add a Creative with unique identifier from request as a key and exception/error message as value.
